Intervention: Ixabepilone 32 mg/m^2 was administered by intravenous infusion (IV) for 3 hours on day 1 of each 21-day treatment cycle. Capecitabine 1650 mg/m^2/day was administered on days 1 to 14 of each 21-day treatment cycle.

Ixabepilone 40 mg/m^2 was administered by intravenous infusion (IV) for 3 hours on day 1 of each 21-day treatment cycle. Capecitabine 1650 mg/m^2/day was administered on days 1 to 14 of each 21-day treatment cycle.
Eligibility: A histologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of adenocarcinoma from the breast
Number of previous chemotherapy treatment lines in the metastatic setting 3
Results: Participants with a Toxic Limit Dose (DLT)
DLT has been defined as any event related to ixabepilone and/or capecitabine requiring discontinuation of the study during the first two treatment cycles.
Time limit: From the initiation of the medicine to the last day of cycle 2 (Day 42)

Ixabepilone 32 mg/m^2 was administered by intravenous infusion (IV) for 3 hours on day 1 of each 21-day treatment cycle. Capecitabine 1650 mg/m^2/day was administered on days 1 to 14 of each 21-day treatment cycle.

Ixabepilone 40 mg/m^2 was administered by intravenous infusion (IV) for 3 hours on day 1 of each 21-day treatment cycle. Capecitabine 1650 mg/m^2/day was administered on days 1 to 14 of each 21-day treatment cycle.
